lead_paragraph: An accident involving a ferry and kayakers on the Hudson demonstrates the increasing demands on the rivers and other bodies of water around the city.

byline.contributor: Samantha Schmidt contributed reporting, and Susan C. Beachy contributed research.
byline.original: By SARAH MASLIN NIR and ELI ROSENBERG

headline.print_headline: ­Recreation and Commerce Collide on City’s Crowded Waterways
headline.main: ­Recreation and Commerce Collide on New York’s Crowded Waterways

snippet: An accident involving a ferry and kayakers on the Hudson demonstrates the increasing demands on the rivers and other bodies of water around the city....
abstract: Many boating experts say recent collision between ferry and group of kayakers on Hudson River was inevitable given chaotic marine traffic conditions in area; note growing number of commercial and recreational craft of all kinds competing for space on waterways around New York City.
